thread.title_full: WATCH: LSU discusses Saturday's game against USC in news confere - FOX 8 WVUE New Orleans News, Weather, Sports, Social

author: WAFB Staff
title: WATCH: LSU discusses Saturday's game against USC in news confere
text:
BATON ROUGE, LA (WAFB) - If viewing this story on a mobile device or in an email, click the link to watch the news conference - http://shout.lt/bfpXz
LSU head coach Les Miles addressed the media at 6 p.m. to talk about Saturday’s LSU-South Carolina football game that will now be held at Tiger Stadium. LSU also had a 5 p.m. news conference with Athletic Director Joe Alleva to discuss the logistics of the game.
Kickoff for the game has been set for 2:30 p.m. Central on Saturday. No word yet on which channel will televise the game. It was originally set to air on ESPN at 11 a.m. Central before the move to Baton Rouge.
The LSU ticket office reported season ticket holders will get the first shot at purchasing tickets at some time Wednesday afternoon. The general public will be allowed to purchase tickets starting Thursday at 6 p.m.
#LSU ticket office - season ticket holders get first shot this afternoon sometime, general public Thursday 6 pm. @Wafb
— Jacques Doucet (@JacquesDoucet) October 7, 2015 Tickets that were issued for the game when it was scheduled to be played in South Carolina will not be valid at Tiger Stadium. Click here for more ticket and parking information .
WAFB will carry this news conference live on WBXH-TV and will stream it live on WAFB.COM and on the WAFB Mobile APP.
WBXH-TV airs locally on Cox Cable Channel 16 (HD 1016), EATEL Channel 16, AT&T U-Verse Channel 39 (1039 HD), Dish Network Channel 39, Charter Cable Channel 182, and on over-the-air antenna 9.4 (39.1 HD).
